      • handleException

        protected void handleException(Throwable x)
        Description copied from class: HttpChannel

        Sends an error 500, performing a special logic to detect whether the request is suspended, to avoid concurrent writes from the application.

        It may happen that the application suspends, and then throws an exception, while an application spawned thread writes the response content; in such case, we attempt to commit the error directly bypassing the ErrorHandler mechanisms and the response OutputStream.

        Overrides:
        handleException in class HttpChannel<ByteBuffer>
        Parameters:
        x - the Throwable that caused the problem

      • failed

        public void failed()
        Description copied from class: HttpChannel
        If a write or similar to this channel fails this method should be called. The standard implementation of HttpChannel.failed() is a noop. But the different implementations of HttpChannel might want to take actions.
        Overrides:
        failed in class HttpChannel<ByteBuffer>

      • messageComplete

        public boolean messageComplete()
        Specified by:
        messageComplete in interface HttpParser.HttpHandler<ByteBuffer>
        Overrides:
        messageComplete in class HttpChannel<ByteBuffer>
